Message.Msg: I know how AMZN has been manipulated. Its right under everyone's red noses. What many don't know is that when they buy QLD UPRO SSO QQQ let alone SPY or TQQQ and the countless other tech and target market ETFs (imagine all the mutual funds let alone iShares Direxion etc) that AMZN is almost always a component. Even when a raunchy bear has "switched sides" and gone bull for an hour here and there they unknowingly contributed to buying overvalued AMZN rising on that hour or day as the case might be. Not on their life would they ever think to be long AMZN at such crazy valuation, but the banks created this lack of trust on the liquidity side by NOT HAVING TRANSPARENCY from the getgo. If the shadow banking system told society at large the truth - that they planned (in synch) to buy the market at 666 and hold for a few years, then people could've put the real mob criminals away on the biggest insider trading scandal in market history. They have no unwinding plan, so this could go down $10 today and won't surprise me the least. Shorts mostly gave up so there exists little to hold this pig up hereon.

Message.Title: Fancy that, amzn at 232.5- Manipulation
Message.Msg: Funny how it just hugs that line to defend massive options play. How long have i been saying this? Wait for the 17th my friends. They could still squeeze you like last friday. Call the sec, it will do no good. these criminals. There is no price discovery in this market, just churn and manipulation. Stop trading until January or fiscal cliff deal, euro resolution. You have little to lose by watching the fakeouts. Up 150, down 300, they are playing games with real peoples' 401ks and pensions. This is American, not JPM's casino. 232.5 is the magic number, they won't let it fall past there significantly, and they will abandon it on or after options day. Weak guidance and unbelievable PE, but they are leveraged into their calls so will play with it. TRUST ME. I am cash, want short shares, but waiting for the next tape painting churn short squeeze. Analysts are being paid handsomely and likely extorted, so will find any dumb thing to say to coax your money in. #$%$.

Topic.Title: What happens when the price finally takes out the magic $230-232 level?

Message.Msg: Soon we break our 52 week high in what will be an awesome week for Amazon, will we stop at 280 and form a base or will a monster squeeze go ahead and send us to the 300 mark. One day soon they will give us an idea how many Kindles are selling. My guess is that it is a lot and Amazon will make money off of a high% of those kindles. When Amazon starts making money the shorts will need to come up with another reason to short the stock besides its PE, linked in has a crazy pe, so do a few others. People that enjoy trading and like to trade, they trade Amazon stock. I trade in and out of it a couple times a week, the option premiums spike and decline rapidly, that makes for an awesome trading environment. I can see Amazon easily at 300 by the end of the year regardless of what the rest of the market does. Look at Apple, some traders will be looking for other places to trade, other names (at least for the remainder of 2012)

Message.Msg: The great thing about selling (shorting) Amazon is that it is setup to lose in a hyperinflationary, inflationary, disinflationary or deflationary macroeconomic environment. Selling Amazon is a robust strategy for virtually every realistic macroeconomic scenario.... Those that think otherwise should read Ray Dalio's primer on how the economy works. You might come to understand why... Good luck with your 52 week high...

Topic.Title: By the way techstrategy: INTC as new 52 week lows now, AMZN's was what? 167? lol!!

Message.Msg: For those of you who are investors, I will connect a dot or two on INTC. Most of the worlds FPGA chips (used extensively for signal processing and communications technology) are manufactured in Taiwan. It is a massive national security issue (see Panetta's comments on Huwaei and ZTE hardware, which is a separate, but related issue). The TCO of using foreign made chips in is too high. DOD (and domestic companies with a clue that care about corporate espionage) realize we need domestic foundries. Guess who has the most advanced and secure foundries with excess capacity that will soon be upgraded to 14nm? Google "FPGA foundries" and read the article "The Hunt for the Kill Switch". It should scare the crap out of you. It should also make you realize why investing in INTC is very wise in light of recent comments about communications security.... More to come. Selling AMZN and buying INTC at these levels will price to be the best investment decision you ever make.
